review: Had some terrible muscle spasms everywhere on my body that lasted for hours i took 20mg of baclofen my spasms stopped and it changed my very bad sleeping routine from sleeping at 5 am to 9pm I woke up very uplifted and euphoric with no body soreness.
Did not help me for low back pain. Caused very dry mouth, muscle cramps, head ache, insomnia

Since Costco pharmacy switched providers to Zydus my muscle spasms/spasticity due to MS have become worse. When I took the Baclofen I found from another pharmaceutical company I noticed a decrease in spasms within 24 hours. It makes me wonder about the purity of their (Zydus) drug.

Worked well for muscle spasms, however it made my pupils extremely dilated at 5mg. My anesthesiologist increased my dosage to 5mg, 3x a day. Huge mistake. I ended up in the emergency room and was loopy and so nauseated I vomited every drop left in my stomach even with 8mg IV Zofran (ondansetron). Decent medication, but not for everyone.

Nothing else prescribed has worked for tight cramping muscles. Really hoping to be able to replace the very expensive medical cannabis oil with my free prescription for baclofen so I can sleep and not be locked up with spasms and cramps. CIPN and muscle spasms post chemo are exhausting. Will follow up later. Dose 1 and sleepy two hours in…fighting to stay awake. Yay!

For three years or so prescribed 10mg three times a day for extremely painful muscle spasms in feet, calves, thighs in several places, abdomen, forearms and hands.  Toes and fingers will curl grotesquely as though I have extreme arthritis;  ankles turn on their sides.  You want to SCREAM!  I take just two of the three, as they do the trick (I resist over medicating).  BUT, if I miss a dose the symptoms reoccur within hours at which times the spasms cease in 20-30 minutes.I've experienced no negative side effects.  Frankly, I couldn't live without Baclofen!!!  (Or, Gabapentin; but, its potential side effects are potentially more scary.)
Wanted to try a different muscle relaxer for my Ankylosis Spondylitis so Dr prescribed Baclofen.  I have had nothing but headaches and nausea.  Horrible drug.
Baclofen has been helping with my back spasms so much, it relaxes me enough to get a decent nights sleep also.

No significant benefit. Shoulder spacticity. Left. Perhaps a bit worse with increasing dose 5 mg 5 mg 10mg. Will continue working out in gym and try acupuncture. 14 months out from minor stroke. Good luck all. Keep trying. Never give up?

Has not helped my pain, nor muscle spasms at all can't sleep. I think the doctor wants me to give up on life. Explained my condition and what would help with no side effects and would not need to take every day did not hear or did not care
Works on my facial and eye spasm and pain (Blephrospasm), but made cramping in legs worse. I have to get up 5x a night to urinate. The leg cramping wakes me, my blood work showed poor kidney enzymes.

I have been taking baclofen 10mg for 13 years its a wonder drug.  It helps with my MS pain I also take vitamin d 2000mg in the morning and 500mg cod liver tablets.  I also take 200mg gabapentin x3 as well as modafilnil 100mg x2 the modafilnil is also a great as it gives me energy and stops the drowsy effects of the other drugs

Baclofen has made a real difference, both in pain levels and how I perceive it. I have had near-constant thoracic pain and radiculopathy for years, since being treated for spinal TB. I lost a disc before I was properly diagnosed and treated, in India. US doctors missed it for years so I'm lucky to be alive and walking. I now have bone spurs and relentless pain, along with degenerative disc disease. I've been taking Baclofen for only about 3 weeks but it made a difference at once. The pain is reduced, I sleep better and, while the burning and aching never entirely subside, I don't notice it nearly as much. It has also reduced my anxiety and my appetite. That may sound good, but I'm a person who doesn't eat when I'm in pain or otherwise distressed.
I have back problems which have been the root cause of many other PREVENTABLE problems my whole life. I wish I knew about this sooner...
Scary medicine BEWARE DOUBLE VISION

I have been prescribed baclofen for several years now. My exact view is still cloudy but here goes. First let us review my Potential Sources for spasmodic responses .   Head injury 1968       Fractured C SPINE C1 to C 7 inclusive . 2 pro-disk implants and a C6/7 fusion.  Fractured L spine L1 to L4 inclusive Deteriorating L 5 S1 Disk space.  severe tinnitus 65 db  Medications prescribed may be at issue .Emtec 30,  25 years continuous meds  seem to work far better when electrolytes are balanced Spasm's reduced to 0 . Spasms I  take Baclofen for . CIPN came on my list of pains in 2016 and made spasms greatly increased in severity. Spasticity of joints has increased  from rare to permanent.  In toes and fingers hand and leg cramps are common despite medications .  Electrolyte balance is critical to reducing spasms .

Are you out of your mind! I took this medicine back in 2015 I was  allergic to this drug I was having double vision horrible insomnia and diarrhea I was taking this three times a day and had nasty side effects...

This is going to seem strange but I took baclofen for a year or so circa 2017 and don’t specifically  remember why at the moment. But I had a lot left over. Within the past 6 months I started getting strong, long-lasting muscle spasms in my calves. The type of spasm that involuntarily turned my ankle and twisted my pinky toe. Nothing helped. And then I remembered my left over baclofen. I took it while a spasm was in progress at 4am and it stopped immediately.

Have been using as needed for muscle pain in my neck and shoulder for about a year. I take it at night and it helps prevent waking up with headaches. I do have bouts of nausea. But I’m unsure if it is due to the Baclofen or by the copious amounts of ibuprofen I’ve taken over the years. I try not to use it in the daytime if I can help it as it makes me drowsy.

Baclofen helped with the muscle spasms long enough for me to get to sleep, but the effects didn't carry into the next day. It made me slightly manic, like I'd had way too much coffee, but not enough to be dangerous. I had a doctor tell me not to make major life decisions on this drug, and I see why. The worst of it though it's the vivid, terrifying nightmares where I felt like I was in real danger and woke up screaming. They don't wear off fast either - I couldn't find my phone and remember thinking I'd left it in my dream. I woke up and thought some dream-entity had replaced my sleeping partner. And of course, my partner doesn't sleep well when I wake up screaming.
Baclofen has helped me more than any other muscle relaxant that I have used.

I have been on baclofen for years for muscle spasms at night.  About six months ago, I began waking up at night with severe pain in my ankles and the arteries in my lower leg were bulging out.  Nothing would help the pain.  It would just have to go away on its own after a few mins of walking.  I ran out of baclofen and didn't take it for about 4 days.  Immediately, I had no more ankle pain at night.  It was a godsend that I ran out.  I will never take it again!  For muscle cramps, I just now take a muscle relaxer as needed.

Been using baclofen for 2 months used to have shooting pains and would be unable to sleep because of throbbing muscle pain. I guess I am lucky one because I have had no side effects. I am unable to take NSAIDs because of possible liver damage and allergic to Tylanol.  This has been a good medicine for me.

I was on this for Condochondritis an I had a severe allergic reaction that lasted so far 5 days with this medication. I have went to the er 3 times and have to take Benadryl around the clock every 4 hours to stay stable. It’s horrible. I only took on 10 mg pill.
Baclofen does not work for muscle spasms. Soma, Diazepam, Flexirile. Is much better for muscle spasms.

I have a herniated disc in my neck and I thought I was dying. The muscles spasms were compressing a nerve that went down to my right arm from my neck. Holy cow I don’t wish that pain on my enemy. UC prescribed this for the extreme spasms and it worked for three days so far 3x daily. Weird feelings and some weird very minor what I would call hallucinating now and again, but much more bearable than the spasms. I couldn’t even move my arm and neck before taking this.
I cannot belive all the negative things being said about this med. as being an RN and having the unfortunate problem of paralysis from the neck down I would not be walking today without baclofen

I was prescribed this medicine for my hip bursitis because I could not sleep on my sides. I took it at 10:30pm when I went to bed. I didn't wake up enough to get out of bed until about 3:30 PM. It is now almost 9:00 PM and I am still groggy and not able to function very well. I slept super sound, did a lot of dreaming that I remember. I slept super soundly, did not suffer with hip pain that hurt when I turned on my side. BUT I was unable to function wake up the entire next day. For me the drug is NOT something I believe is helpful.
Helps with spams & spacisity but making nerve pain worse

I used baclofen for headaches due to injuries from a car accident. I was doing well on 10mg  once a day. A month later my doctor bumped it up to 20mg 4 times a day!!! That caused dizziness. I also missed a day and oh boy!!!!!! Withdrawal was MISERABLE! It truely was the worst !!!!! Anxiety and heart palpitations throughout the night . Kept me up and couldn’t sleep, felt like I had to go to the ER. Felt like this for days even though I was taking it like normal (20mg 4 times a day). It did not help with sleep even when I didn’t have the withdrawal problems. Def would not recommend this drug if you don’t have severe muscle spasms !
Please please please stay away from this medicine, it’s poison to your brain. If you are taking it and ever need to stop please read about the withdrawals before hand.

Baclofen is sometimes ordered by pain clinics for muscle spasms without consideration for the very bad side effects. Baclofen is given for spasticity. Pain clinics need to understand this. Also not good for the elderly. Pain clinics often use off label drugs for pain but patients end up with reactions that can often be  severe.
I experience frequent urination through the night joint stiffness and tenderness and muscle cramps in my calves after two days of taking it

I've only taken  two 20mg pills .Wow. I cried in the morning .It took 10 minutes to put on my socks and shoes. I took a Advil and Turmeric in the morning.Still was stiff and in pain. About 12pm. I took my baclofen  pill. With in an hour I could move freely. And I was in a wonderful mood. No side effects yet, and I hope I don't have any. I was prescribed this as two 20mg a day. I have to have hip replacement next month. And my partial knee too .I took an arthritis pain relief about 30 minutes ago, To help ease that pain. Will take my second dose. So I can be pain free and sleep well. Going to ask for a refill.  I think its a great all around pill

I have developed chronic back pain and muscle spasms in my low back that has progressively gotten worse over the last 40 years.  The muscle spasms increased to over a dozen events in a day.  After 10 failed steroid injections from multiple doctors and four abalations, I was resigned to live with the pain and medically retire.  Baclofen has reduced the number of spasms and their intensity to about four events in a week!  I too experienced the sleepiness for the first couple of days.  With the intensity and number of spasms reduced so low, pain management has been much better.  Time will tell if I have to reconsider early retirement.

I been suffering everyday  from neck muscle spasms tightness symptoms for over a year now....The pain management doctor put me on baclofen 20mg twice daily ...I experienced horrible mouth symptoms everyday...I haven’t felt much of this medicine working ...My family doctor told me to increase the baclofen 20 mg twice daily...Again horrible nauseating dry mouth everyday and not feeling any improvement of my neck condition...I will stop taking this medicine....

Been suffering Lumbar L1 to L5 now for 15 years. Spinal stenosis in L2 to L4.Basically Drs running out of pain medication.Was given Baclofen one 10mg tab 3 times a day ,no serious side effects, no more than slow released oxycodone.But basically now on the maximum dose 3 times a day. Noticed that restored a little help in that the spasms are less aggressive. But like anything for scale 50 pain is that I finding now its become less effective as body starting to get use to it.But used with Diazepam on a flare up the 2 work well together to calm a sudden onset

My doctor prescribed this medication for my elbow. I've been having pain with extension/ flexion, and I have psoriasis so I think that may be the cause. Anywho, I started this last night while I wait on my dermatology referral. I slept great last night. However, I woke up in a fog. I could barely function at all. Luckily, I put it all aside just to take my kids to school. After I got home, I got ready to go to the gym and fell asleep on the bed, with my shoes still on. I am still feeling the effects of it and I will not be taking it again.

Have been taking baclofen med for about three weeks at 10 mg...helps with pain but the side effects stops me from living and doing what I need to.  I am dizzy/disoriented/sometimes feels like a small electric shock to the brain and this is day two.  I may need to take 5mg and see if my body handles it better...waiting on my doc to decide what is best....

The baclofen I took for muscle spasm spiked my Tinnitus considerably.  I had to stop taking it after just a few days and my Tinnitus has returned to the point before starting this drug.I honestly could tell no reduction in my pain while taking it.
My doctor put me on baclofen  three times a day for my back.  I also take it for leg cramps and it works wonders.  It is a lifesaver for me.

Baclofen is the only muscle relaxant my Pain Dr. will prescribe for me. - I have arthritis in my neck that causes headache pain. Seriously sugar pills do better. Absolutely does nothing. Taking the prescribed amount of one 10 MG  tab every 8 hours. Definitely does nothing for my headaches.

Horrible medication , took it for the first time tonight , fell asleep,  woke up and felt I was not alive !!! I started having panic attack thought I was going to end at E.R , Never again am I taking this medication .
Does absolutely nothing for my neck pain.

I fell and have had muscle spasms in my mid and upper back. Couldn’t sleep it hurt so bad. Had massage. Took steam shower. Took Advil. Went to my doctor and get this rubbish drug. I took it as prescribed and it’s like a placebo. It didn’t do anything at all. Calling back my doctor for something else first thing today!

Wife took 2 pills on a Thursday. 20 mg about10 hours apart. Friday called ems for having aSeziure.  Now in ICU fightingfor her life.  It has been 4 days now.  She had prior strokes and stage four kidney disease.Be careful if you take this drug.

Had severe Muscle Spasm on Thursday evening and took a total of of 2 tablets one Thurs. and one Fri. morning. The following of what happened I have no recollection of and it has only been told to me.  Fri. morning I was sitting in my recliner and had to go to bathroom  and I could not get out of the chair by myself. with help I was taken to the bathroom door. My lady friend could not get me into bathroom. She said she looked at my eyes and said my eyes were wide open but no one was home, and she called EMS. while being transported to hospital I stopped breathing and again in the ER at hospital. At that time I was put on life support. After many test which all came up negative it was the consensus it had to be the medication as I had never taken Baclofen before. After more than a week in the hospital I am exhibiting no after effects.

Take Baclofen for degenerative disc disease and sciatica. This stuff works great. Takes my pain from an 8 or 9 to a 4. I have also found Baclofen to work wonders for my severe debilitating anxiety. I take 10mg 3x daily

I took this for terrible back pain, and noticed it also completely got rid of migraines. I only take it at night as it makes me drowsy. It works better than any inflammatory or pain relief medication I’ve ever taken. It’s the only thing that allows me to sleep when I get back spasms of migraines
Made me stupid. Couldn’t process thoughts properly. Gave me muscle twitches. Made me so sleepy I couldn’t stay awake. Would NEVER recommend.

First off, to the people expressing relief from this atrocity, let me say that I am glad it has worked for. That being said. My back pain has gone from severe to excruciating. I have no clue as to why, but I am discontinuing this Rx immediately. Dosage info. 10 mg 3x a day

Hi everyone, I have been on baclofen for 10 years now for Multiple sclerosis fibromyalgia diabetes rheumatoid arthritis. I'm always in chronic pain. I have muscle spasms in my whole body. Thankful for the baclofen because I don't have hardly any  spasms now. I use to get spasm in my throat, my chest, hands, feet everywhere. It doesn't work for my pain but it works for spasms.  I didn't think it was working, so I stopped taking it. In a couple of days  I was in terrible shape!! I quickly dug them out of the closet and took some!I I stay in pain daily. I have many chronic health conditions that are not curable.
I take baclofen for chronic back pain, and it gets the job done. I do get tired sometimes. I take 10mg 3x a day.

I personally will NEVER TAKE THIS RX AGAIN !!! I'd just gotten a Rx for a 30 days worth  at a dose of 3 times a day.  I took it one day & ended up in 2 different ER's & then I was admitted for 2 day's! !! All the tests I was put through, first of all, 4 out of 5 of them weren't  too bad & one was a living nightmare. It came down to, that was the ONLY thing I'd  had that was different.  It's now a med. that I have to put on a severe allergic reaction to. So, thanks ever so much to the manufacturer of that med. for totally putting me through the worst experience
My goodness, I have been looking for years to find relief. for muscle spasm. Baclofen 10mg has been a godsend. Pain gone. Thanks to my wonderful Dr.

Was Rx'd Baclofen by a psychiatrist during intense "P/T Mngt" Program for Cervical Spine. Found it ineffective as a Muscle Relaxant & when my upper body would seize together in a "lock down", Baclofen did not budge a fibre loose. I give it a 0 in comparison to Valium (Diazepam), which was Rx'd by my psychiatrist who saw my physical distress. Valium is in the Benzo class (Ativan, Zanax) but it functions primarily by relaxing muscles. For me, no dependence or withdrawal symptoms.

Yeah the drug works.  No more back spasms, and no pain at all.  Side effects many this is my first time using it will not use again. Dizzy, stomach aches,  sleepiness. A doctor at the VA in Atlanta, Ga recommended it to me.  I am not a disabled veteran, if I was I would be able to get my teeth fixed.

I have stiff trapped muscles  that I used to take Klonipin off label to help relax them. PM doc won't prescribe them but will write for 20 baclofen 10 mg a month. I have the worse tendonitis and neck spasms ever taking them. Can't win.

I been on baclofen for 3 days ,and I'm having more spasms then ever before -  to the point it's cramping I am not able to use my right arm and I'm right handed get spasm when I use bathroom I'm ready to go to ER  that's how bad it is. I drink more water thinking that will help subside the spasm but that's not working. are these side effects? I have had headache also it cause blood pressure to go up
username: my spasm are worse since start

review: After a typical ACL reconstruction - my central nervous system went haywire. It's thought that I might have had an adverse rection to the Lyrica that I was put on shortly after my operation. Doctors have no idea why and for months after I had agonising nerve pain all over my body. After a few months, the only pain I have left has been in my lower back. Although I can still function - it was bad enough that I dreaded simple things like car trips or sitting at my desk at work. My GP suggested Baclofen and it's done wonders. I only take one 10mg tablet at night but it's enough that I have no muscle pain at all. It's  been a miracle and I've had literally no side effects (probably due to being on such a low dose).

I have very bad muscle spasms and cramps  that turn my foot completely sideways and splay all my toes. It’s excuciating pain. Baclofen made it worse. The day I tried it I had the spasms 12 times during the night. Won’t be taking it again. I guess crying and screaming is my option.

I have a rare form of muscular dystrophy this drug lets me lead a normal life. Been on it for over 17 years now, no side affects, but takes away my spastic problems. Highly recommend and so grateful for it.
I take 10mg 3 times a day, this medicine does nothing for my pain. It side effect is that make me hyper...

Unless you have MS or are in DIRE need of spasticity reduction, i would recommend no one take this stuff. It is a nasty, nasty, nasty drug, made me feel out of it, slurred speech. It also caused me to develop sleep apnea, and it also increased my anxiety. It also makes it hard to breathe when laying down. Weaning off of it was awful, wave after wave of anxiety and then aggression.  I'd rather have back spasms then feel the way it did. I weaned totally off it 48 hrs ago and I've had hiccups for 14 hrs and some agitation.

I have only used baclofen for 3 weeks but I can say it is truly a miracle drug for me. I have suffered from chronic pain for 20 years after a motorcycle accident that resulted in fractures of T1 2 in 3 of my transverse processes and displacement of 2 other vertebras including 13 other fractures including punctured lungs and separations in my shoulder and clavicle. I know everybody on this post has serious pain. I tried every narcotic pain medication even becoming chemically dependent and eventually addicted to many of them and 4 other muscle relaxers and every other treatment (PT, acupuncture surgeries etc.) that I'm sure everybody on this board has tried. I have serious scar tissue in my upper back lower neck which caused me constant and severe pain. I stumbled upon baclofen going to urgent care to get a toradol shot just to make it so I could sleep that night. After I woke up the next morning taking my 1st dose of baclofen I had 50%+ pain reduction! For those of you that suffer from true chronic pain that is life affecting every minute of your life you can understand why I'm in tears writing this post. I cannot believe I had never tried this medication. I'm sure it does not work the same for everybody but when it works it is a miracle drug! I now can sleep the whole night and when I wake up in the morning I am not dreading a day of pain. Let me be clear I had 20 years of debilitating pain every minute I was awake unless I sedated myself so much that I could finally fall asleep. I went to four detox centers and two rehabs Because of all the opiate pain medications I was taking and then became addicted to.  I have been suffering through taking naltrexone to keep me from using narcotic pain meds to escape from my pain. I have a whole new life at age 42 now. I pray that this medication works as well for anybody else reading or posting on this site. God bless all of you suffering.
was prescribed baclofen for dystonia .(muscles spasms)..they slowed the spasms a bit but it also  left me sitting on the sofa like a useless lump of flesh.  Horrible drug and side effects

I have taken this medication for a few years and I prefer this shape because it's easier to break. My Pharmacy just switched me to the round pills which I was unhappy about because I can't break those ones as easily and I have yet to find a good pill cutter. I wish they would all be in this shape when pills need to be broken.
I had a terrible experience with panic attack.  I do not believe this medication was appropriate for upper back pain, not identified as spasm.
very bad reaction.  I took this for upper spinal pain and cold symptoms

I got up one morning my eyes was swollen shut as the day processed my lips started swelling in thought it was do to my allergies then my face got a rash on my face then my tongue started to swell along with my throat had to go to the ER

I began taking Baclofen 14 years ago.  I started with 10 mg three times a day.  After six months, my doctor increased it to 20 mg, and I eventually went to 40 mg twice times a day.  Through all of this, I got only marginal relief.  Last year, I had the intrathecal pump installed.  So far, I still have had only marginal relief.  My left hamstrings are very painful throughout the day.  Massage is helpful, but very temporary.  I'd love to find something that really relaxes my spasms.
I have ankylosing spondylitis.  Very painful.  Started taking baclofen  five days ago.  NO relief!  Too early for good results?  Excruciating pain!  Where to get relief?

After using 20 mg in evening...I was getting no relief from muscle spasms, so I spaced dose out to 20mg in afternoon and 20 mg at evening As I got sleepy and dozed off in my chair, I found myself waking, but not breathing, I would have to gasp for a large amount of air and wake up... This went on all evening  This has never happened in my life before,   I repeated this a few days later and same results  OPEN MY EYES AND REALIZE I,M NOT BREATHING AND GASP FOR AS MUCH AIR AS I COULD TAKE.....VERY SCARY.

I've only been on the medication for a as days but it's the first time in years that I haven't had that seized knots in my back . So I am fairly happy with the medication despite the drowsiness its causing.  I hope that in a few weeks the drowsiness will go away. At least it doesn't knock me out like Rosario or tizinadine does.

I was diagnosed with a muscular neurological disorder of unknown origin - SPS - with both my legs becoming stiff and my feet cramping a lot, with no control over lower bodily functions. I was given an Rx @ 20mg X 2 daily and was told to watch gastro for side effects. Didn't really have any problems there but the Rx worked at getting me ambulatory again. I tried to up it to 40mg X 2 daily but it made me sleepy and the Neuro told me better to take the 20 3 or 4 times a day rather than 40mg all at once. As with all Dx and Rx some collaboration with the doctor and experimentation by the Px is required to  find the right Rx dosage for the symptoms. I am able to ride bike, walk and drive, get around, but no quick reflex activity.

I started baclofen 10mg three times a day because I started having painful muscle spasms in both legs usually at night.The spasms are taking longer to end. Bruising  is sometimes noticeable.I started taking the drug 3 months ago, after a car accident.A brain injury was diagnosed.
Started taking for herniated discs in my neck which caused bad migraines. It's pointless to me. Actually gives me headaches. I honestly think Flexeril works better.

I took this for 1 week and not only did it do nothing for my muscle spasms but it made me depressed. I had never been like this in my life!!! Thankfully I realized what was happening and stopped taking them immediately. So, ineffective and severe side effect. Not taking ever again.

I'm on 20 mg of baclofen tid and it works pretty good, takes a little while for it to kick in, but it helps subside my pain/cramps in my legs. I need to ask my doctor to increase my dosage due to the medication not lasting long enough. Overall is a pretty good medication.

First prescribed Baclofen orally for MS. Legs are turning into concrete. I was a zombie for about a year. 7 years ago I made the decision to have a baclofen pump implanted with meds going directly to my spine for my legs. Totally changed my life. No more zombie and spasms under control.(also had dilaudid in pump). Much smaller, concentrated doses going where they need to.It is now time to have surgery to implant another pump, 7 year battery life. I will have to go back on oral doses until healed from surgery. After that refill once a month and good for another 7 years. MS is getting worse but planning on giving it a hell of a fight....lol

I don't notice it working.  I notice when it stops.  Example.  I had a physical therapy pool session.  I overslept and took my 10mg dose 30 minutes before pool time.  I started my session shuffling my feet along the pool floor.  30 minutes in to my pool time I could pick my knees up like a drum majorette.  I convinced my PT about the value of Baclofen.  Like other antispasmodics and pain pills, Baclofen starts working in one hour.  It's helpful to set your alarm an hour early and take it before you get out of bed.I take it for a mitochondrial myopathy.  I always have a low level of spasms that become like charley horses with activity.

Baclofen, has changed my life. CP suffer back surgery , spinal athritis , pinched nerves in my neck. And lower back, before baclofen, 6 panadine forte a day, now I take 3 . 10 mg tabs per day.  Of baclofen No more back spasms. Might take 4 panadine forte a week now. Have been on endep for 2 years. But it doesn't compare. Wonderful .

after just a few days' dosing at 1 20mg every six hours, I started to feel peculiar in the GI tract...all kinds of strangeness.  The drug didn't do enough good for the purpose prescribed, so I quit it and returned the drug to the pharmacy for disposal.
Ithink its great no real problems with side afects.

I was prescribed this medication for my back after 3 days I lost my muscle coordination dropping drinks my  glasses could not focus within in 4  hours I fainted an woke up in hospital 2 days later don't know if it was a stroke or short coma. No one will tell me exactly what happened to me after 2 days off this medication I have had no symptoms. This is a very bad drug

Fell and hurt my back 4 years ago. Suffered from Spasticity in my back, legs and neck ever since. Been taking 10 mg 3 times a day every since. To me this is one of those drugs that you really can't tell you are taking it until you run out. If for some reason I miss a dose I'm miserable. I'm not gonna say it removes all my pain, because it doesn't, but it does allow me to manage the pain I'm in better. The only side effect I noticed was when I first took it I had very vivid dreams for the first few weeks, but that went away quickly.
Was actually put on this medication for hiccups and found that it had good muscle relaxer properties and also helped with mild anxiety.

I was prescribed Baclofen for intermittent spasticity in my thoracic back. Also for neck, and low back spasms/nerve pain, but it's been the thoracic pain in the past 2 years that more often than not is at times literally unbearable. My thoracic back at it's best is constant aching/stabbing. Baclofen stinks, it makes me severely groggy, (but so do many medications) and no pain relief even having tried between low to high dosages.  1500 mgs of Methocarbomol before bed is an oldie but a goodie. It'll put me to sleep during the day too, but at least it works and doesn't have the bizarre loopy type side effects. However I DO NOT take it with any other medication that causes drowsiness, no narcotics, no alcohol etc...

Was taking baclofen 20mg 3 times a day for cervical degenerative disc disease. I didn't think it really helped until I ran out, now I noticed that my neck hurts more and is stiffer. I moved out of state and now I don't qualify for insurance. I also had a hard time sleeping while taking it, but I also have insomnia so I can't say for sure if the baclofen was causing it or not. I just noticed a difference when I ran out.

Was prescribed Baclofen 20 mg and allowed to take one half to one pill per night at bedtime. A few days ago I bent over and couldn't get back up. I am active, not old, and fit. Apparently I pinched/compressed a nerve(s) in my sacral area. I was taking methylcarbanal with little relief. My PCP have me a Toradal shot and Baclofen. Wow! Baclofen worked great but 20mg gave me a hang over the next morning (no headache). Woozy, drunk and floaty feeling. Decided it was best not to drive and stayed home. While I am grateful the Baclofen worked I will be taking 10mg from now on when needed. 20mg is just too strong for me at 5'8 and 140lbs.

I have use Baclofen for some time now but have only in the last 2 to 3 months started to have side effects  such a hallucinations, and seeing and hearing things that are not there.  I also take Requip which also give almost the same side effects.  I also take coumidin(Warfarin)

Was given this drug as opposed to soma. Started taking 20mg 4x a day. That was on a Thursday evening by Friday night I was not making any sense. My husband finally rushed me in to the er when I couldn't answer questions and would only answer in a single word. I was dizzy, lightheaded, nauseous, vomiting, dry mouth, at one point I was doing stuff in the middle of the night. I was hospitalized until things resolved

I had a spinal fusion on July 2015 n have had extreme nerve issues since then n numbness on my left side.  I have been on everything woth no relief.  Tried Baclofen 10 ml 3x day. Had some pain relief 1st day..since then nothing but very sleepy.  Why would work on 1st day then nothing??
Helps with stiff and hurting muscles due to ms

I've got Arthritis in my hips and legs and about two months ago I was switched to this from flexarell because it stopped working, well baclofen doesn't seem to help either been in bed for 2 days and can't sleep or even lift my new born grandchild. I've pulled a muscle in my lower back now and in so much pain

I felt a burning sensation in my stomach. My ortho took it upon himself to change from diazapam to baclofen. I've been not sleeping, and I'm irritable. I've filed a complaint thru my insurance, as well as the ortho office. It's Sunday, but I have a 915 appt with the ortho.

I'm taking baclofen for extreme tightness in my neck and shoulders, works fine. However is more of a stress relief and sleeping pill, especially if you are already a bit drowsy. I take 10mg currently and I personally don't think its enough because it doesn't do too much. especially at night when I need it to work fastest because my muscles tighten at the end of the day.

Lioresal (baclofen):Loss leg with riding lawn mower. Still have side effects! The leg  I still have jerks and I still feel the pain of the lawn mower going over my leg. Not at all times but when they do I can't get the pain  or the spasms to let up!

I was prescribed Baclofen to help spasms and pain caused by my generalised dystonia with severe tremor. Initially I was put on a very low dose which was to build up gradually. I take a cocktail of daily medication but after two weeks of Baclofen added to my med cocktail I was in less pain. I noticed I'd cut my painkillers from four times a day to only once or twice, I didn't need them. I'm not saying I'm pain free or don't have spasms anymore but I definitely notice a great improvement. I did have unpleasant side effects to begin with, weakness, drowsy, drunk like feeling, it wasn't nice at all but I kept with it, the side effects improved and I'm so relieved I don't suffer the excruciating pain I was in.

I have multiple sclerosis and limited use of my right arm and right leg I was given this drug to help with it. I have more trouble walking I have to use my scooter all the time and it makes me so sleepy. I find myself sleeping until noon then falling asleep late in the evening. I find this medicine not helpful at all. I take 10mg 3 times a day.

Baclofen gave me terrible dream/nightmares and I would "walk in my sleep" during them,  that is, getting out of my bed and literally trashing my bedroom, knocking everything off the nightstand, flipping over my computer chair, tried to crawl under a TV tray... crazy stuff, that I NEVER did before.  As soon as I quit the baclofen (thinking that must be it),  those dreams never happened again.  PS, since baclofen did this to me, they tried Rx Tizanidine/zanaflex, and I had the SAME reaction from those so I just don't have a muscle relaxer anymore.

no side effects except mild drowsiness. I'm not impressed by how this drug is supposed to work on muscle spasms. I have been on it for week and half at 10 mg 3 times a day. I feel my spasms are almost a bad as prior to taking this Rx

I have a partial spinal cord injury and have lots of muscle spasms everywhere. For a few months after my SCI I had minimal spasms and was on 90 mg/day. I am 4 years out from my accident and my spasms are worse. Now I take 120 mg/day (30 mg 4x/day). I still have a lot of muscle tone (spasms)  and we are discussing putting a baclofen pump in that will pump baclofen directly onto the spinal cord. How do I know baclofen works? On occasion I have missed my 10 pm pills and by morning my muscles are so tight I can't move. I believe the maximum does is 90 mg/day but the doc put me up to 120/mg to give me more relief. I'll be on it for life. Great stuff, wouldn't be able to move without it. I have had no side effects even with the elevated dose.

Been put on Baclofen after taking Valium for a number of years for left sided spasming due to cluster migraine and fibromyalgia, Bells Palsy and Restless leg Syndrome. It has helped me immensely and helped me move again. I can even walk again.

I have extensive nerve damage in my spinal cord and was prescribed baclofen for spasms. It works great on the spasms however, I can take the prescribed dose and when I run out of vicodin then it causes me restless leg syndrome so be careful if you're also on opioids and run out. For cramps in the legs it is great though.

I initially took this bc of muscle cramps but was surprised at how easily it helped me fall asleep and feel at ease well rested and stress free the next day.  I have taken trazodone before for my anxiety and this was ten times better. Trazodone has nothing on this. Not sure why this isn't prescribed for anxiety and insomnia instead.

I was given this because I fell and landed on my ribs against a day bed which is very little bed and mostly metal.  Not sure if it worked since the side effects were such a problem.  I was very emotional and balled like a baby for 3-4 hours.  I had chest pains, weight gain, stomach pain, unsteadiness, and blurred vision.  I quit taking the drug on the 5th day after googled the side effects (since the drug store information didn't say anything about any of these side effects).  Oh and I still have what feels like a bad yeast infection with blood.

I suffer with Ehlers Danlos Syndrome and suffer from chronic muscle spasms that affect my whole body and they are terribly painful.  I was recently switched to baclofen and all I can say is - wow!!  I can actually MOVE again.  I had actually forgotten what it feels like to be able to move.  No side effects either and great pain relief.  Absolutely over the moon.
I have a spinal cord injury and have intense spasticity in my legs and this medicine helped in just a few hours of taking it.
Lioresal (baclofen):Been taking these due to 2 back surgeries within a 9 month period. Doesn't really help with my muscle spasms.

I have a lot of different pains due to fibromyalgia and nerve damage and sciatica and a stroke and spinal cord disease I take 1 20 milligram at night only because it does make you very tired and only time I really noticed it working is when I don't take it then my pain is much worse.

I am 33 & I have protruding discs at my L3-S1 levels. I am in pain management until I can have surgery. Because of the condition of my discs I have electric, debilitating muscle spasms in my lower back. At the time of my most recent episode, I was on 10 mg Valium for muscle relaxant & 10 mg Flexeril. The Flexeril & Valium did nothing, nothing for my spasms. Luckily, I had an appointment with my pain management doctor, and he prescribed Baclofen as he could feel the spasms. I was told to stop Flexeril and take the Baclofen -- which I did immediately (10 mg). Baclofen was miraculous! It stopped the spasms almost immediately & by the next morning (today), my back felt almost completely normal. Thank you. I can actually make it to work!!

I was put on Baclofen for migraine/cluster headache as a treatment prevention and rescue medicine. It works great for me. It also helps my spasms from having a bladder and kidney disease and ruptured discs. It doesn't help the nerve pain, but overall I think it's better than every other muscle relaxer I've tried. I've had reactions to most and very allergic to Flexeril. I take 20mg up to 4x a day. I'm also okay on Percocet and Klonopin. The 3 make everyday life with constant pain and headaches a lot easier to deal with.

Thrilled to say the least. I have a prolapsed disc in L4/ L5. The pain and spasms I get as a result are absolute modern day torture. I had another spasm today whilst a long way from home and my normal GP. I went to a drop in clinic and the doc prescribed Baclofen. I've never had such relief. I've had all types of medicines, from Valium to Celebrex and the norm over counter medicines. This is by far the best. Also have bipolar and am on methadone for a painkiller addiction. I have to say that I am excited by the prospect of how this new medication could potentially change my everyday life. And so much the better if it helps with anxiety and withdrawal from opioids.

I've had sciatica for 20 years. On and of a number of different meds but had negative effects. Had a bad fall Oct 30-2013 (i'm 65 on walker and canes) and square on my coccyx. Oh boy. Doc gave me Toradol pills--nothing, then cyclobenzaprine--bad effect, then BACLOFEN 5MG 3X DAY DOES HELP ME SLEEP AT NIGHT. ON IT NOW A MONTH.

Taking for neck and back pain, and sciatica from being in a MVA.  Seems to make my hearing sensitive--when I read to my daughter, it's like my voice is too loud so I have to speak very softly.  Absolutely no drowsiness, but I have had a killer headache in the back of my head for days.  It has not made any drastic difference in my muscle pain and sciatica, but I have only been on it less than one week.  Will keep trying it until my follow up in a week.  So far, so good, except for the bad, bad headache in the back of my head.  Sleeping good and waking refreshed, unlike when I took Soma.

I take 10mg at 60mg a day for a nerve impingement in my shoulder, a herniated disc and sciatica. In the past I have tried Vicodin, Percocet, oxycodone 15, Flexeril, and Soma. None of those medicines come close to working as well as baclofen. It also works way better than Xanax or Klonopin for anxiety.

Last time I had really bad cramps, several months ago, doctor prescribed 10mg, 3 x's a day, for 10 days. I remembered I was a 'low doser' so I took only half a tablet for 6 days. Result was wonderful! Spasms in diaphragm, bilateral waistline, bilateral buttocks, back, shoulders, neck, hands, legs, feet, lowest abdomen, all ceased and desisted in two and a half days. This time, a couple of days ago, I called for a new prescription and then forgot to take half a pill--took a whole 10mg, 3x's a day for two days, as prescribed, and got treated to a whole bunch of weird side effects--intense sleepiness, hallucinations, very shallow breathing, edema, but no cessation of spasms and pain.  So now I'll wait several days and try half a pill again.

Lioresal (baclofen):I was taken off Soma and put on Baclofen to help with extremely painful muscle spasms that I've been told are related to my fibromyalgia. I was extremely surprised and grateful to find out that this medication while not preventing the spasms, does stop them dead in their tracks when taken as soon as they start. I've had no noticeable side effects. A real God send for me.

I had 2 laminectomies at L4/L5 and the first one failed in 6 years, the second has been holding its own, but scar tissue has formed and the disks above and below are impinging the nerve slightly.  After 2 years of trying every muscle relaxer my pain management doctor used Baclofen 10mg 3 x daily.  I noticed improvement within a week and now in combination with Cymbalta 60mg daily, I can walk on my right leg without having to sit down every 5 minutes.  I don't have any side effects from Baclofen like Flexeril where I would drag all day and then the next day feel hung over and could not get off the couch.
Lioresal (baclofen):Taking 20mg per day of Baclofen for Levator Syndrome (pelvic muscle spams). The only thing that has ever worked for this condition. No side effects that I can tell.

I too suffer from back and leg pain. I have had 3 surgery's pain stimulator implanted as well. The back and leg spasms have gotten so bad starting around 2pm till I wake in the morning. Some nights I'm up all night. Started medicines as directed 1st time. But had some very strange reactions. Like I couldn't breath, almost paralyzed, then hives. So I stopped. But the spasms became so bad, I just couldn't bare to go on anymore this way. I started again taking 1/2 a pill 2 times then 3 times. So far I just itch, I can deal with that. It is helping with spasms,  that is the best part of all. And OMG if it also helps with migraines, that would be even better, since I am also being treated for them as well. Life can be unbearable. Thanks for help.

I have bone spurs on my cervical spine and I have severe muscle spasms and chronic back pain along with restless syndrome and degenerative bone disease. Yes I'm also falling apart and I'm only 38 yrs old. My doctor tried different scripts to relieve the pain and burning in my neck and shoulder but I never found relief until I started taking 10mg Baclofen. It also helped me at night with my insomnia. I thank my doctor at every visit. I'd still be in pain if it weren't for Baclofen.

I have severe back pain, and nerve impingement. I have tried at least 7 medications that are used to treat this disorder. There are some that work better but the side effects make it impossible to live a normal life. There are those that don't work at all. This is the only medication that I have taken that allows me to live a normal life. I can sit in a chair or ride in a car without my back spasms killing me. Baclofen is the only medicine I have found that allows me to work without spasms, and not be so fatigued like a zombie.
Lioresal (baclofen):I find this medication has been great in controlling the muscle spasms I have been experiencing. However it isn't very effective in easing the neuropathic pain I also experience.

I had back surgery- severe, debilitating migraines (one per week)- a stroke at age 30 (8 years ago)- knee, shoulder, wrist, ankle and hand surgeries. Call me Humpty Dumpty because I would have fallen apart but Baclofen has helped put me back together again. It cuts down on the spasms and helps dull the pain. My migraines are down to 1 a month and over within 12-24 hours. I take 10MGs x 8 pills before bed. I take Ambien to help me sleep but have HUGE problems waking up and staying awake. I have fallen asleep at work (bad when you are a teacher). My Dr. started me on Nuvigil 250MG mornings and it is a life/job saver. Also taking Seroquel, Nexium, Triliptal, Exalgo, Lexapro, 15000 UI of vitamin D and had to start Hyzaar since beginning Baclofen.

This medicine should not be given to the elderly due to side effects causing dizziness.  If you are experiencing nausea prior to the use of this medicine, do not take it, it will increase the symptoms.

I have been taking Baclofen for over 5 years for muscle spasms and sciatica. It helps tremendously for the spasms and overall back muscle mobility but does nothing for sciatica pain. This is an outstanding adjunct to an NSAID or other pain reliever. Baclofen has allowed me to completely bend over and put my palms on the floor; something I couldn't do for years. I share the sentiment of an old post that Baclofen off label significantly decreases my anxiety associated with post traumatic stress disorder. I take 10mgs three times a day. Highly recommend this for spasms, anxiety and increased quality of sleep.

Was given this medication post hysteroscopy when I suffered severe hip, knee and leg pain. Nothing touched it. Had major painkillers to no effect. Baclofen was a lifesaver. Also have fibromyalgia and the bonus is I can feel a massive difference with that now as well. Am a bit dizzy, hope it will pass in time cause the benefits are worth it! No other side effects at all.

Finally relief. I have suffered all of my adult life with severe pain from menstrual cramps.  After taking Lupron (which stopped my period) I was left with these reactive painful pelvic/uterine muscle spasms. The muscle would seize up and cause pain for no reason. Baclofen worked from day one.  And no sleepiness and no loopy feeling--very nice.
Take 3x/day for fibromyalgia - lifesaver! Tried almost all other muscle relaxers, and baclofen works the best for chronic muscle spasms and pain.
Back injury: This medicine caused me to jerk uncontrollable. It also caused me to lose time I could not keep my mind straight.

I was using a walking stick 2 weeks ago. I don't feel like my legs are made of rubber anymore and am able to walk short distances without assistance. I am excited about this medication and the future of walking again. I am still working through the need to take an afternoon nap.

I have been struggling with fibromyalgia for more than five years. Finally accepted my diagnoses almost 3 years ago. My doctor and I have been working together to establish a pain management program that works for me and still enables me to work and live a "normal" life. Baclofen is by far the best muscle relaxer I have used and true to my doctors recommendation, has the least side effects (dizziness, sedation, etc.). I am more than just pleased with this medicine. I am THRILLED because it helps to control the muscle spasms I cope with while allowing me to be an active participant in my life. After two years of taking it, I am taking 10mg four times a day.

Prescribed this by pain management doctor along with Roxy 15 mg. Made very sleepy- seeing no improvement with back pain/ leg pain over just taking the Roxy. Side effects are just too many for the slight relief it may have given.

I have a partially paralyzed left leg due to SCI with extreme tone and strong muscle spasms.  The first time I tried Baclofen the side effects were so severe that I could not tolerate the medicine at all.  The second time I worked up to 60mg per day at 5mg intervals over a couple of months. Virtually no side effects at all this time but it takes a while.  Baclofen with Botox injections to my hip flexor, hamstrings, and dorsiflexor make my situation bearable. Baclofen works well at 20mg, less than the prescribed dosage.

After trying several muscle relaxers with no improvement, my new pain management doctor put me on 10mg baclofen 3 x daily.I was extremely drowsy the first week, by second week had complete resolution of my lower back pain following 2 lumbar surgeries to correct scoliosis. First time I can walk and stand straight up in years. Initially helped my neck pain, but is now no longer effective. Having surgery tomorrow to repair subluxation of C3/4, hoping that resolves my pain. Status post surgery x 5 for cervical herniations. May need to adjust dose? Great medicine, highly recommended.

Baclofen is so good! Some drowsiness, although could be from Lyrica, which I stopped today due to my new Fred Flintstone feet (Side effect from Lyrica - needed Ultrasound to rule out DVT - clots in leg). Okay for pain after short buildup period, but after that period I started getting MOST of the listed side effects of Lyrica - including the ER visit with the swollen feet).  I had spinal surgery and now suffer SEVERE back spasms. (I'm worse off after surgery). I now have MORE nerve pain - so hence the Lyrica - and really bad spasms when I stand for short periods or lay in one position and Baclofen is a God send.

I've been taking this medication for so long I don't know if it helps or not.  I have M.S. and severe muscle spasms in my lower back as well as tightness in my legs.  After reading the comments here, I've decided to ask my neurologist to either up the dosage or try another medication.

I only gave this medication a 10 because there wasn't a higher rating available!! I have severe muscle spasms, I also have some myalgias too. With the combo of Lyrcia and baclofen I can walk again without severe pain. I have had no side effects, and I'm not all doped up on Soma anymore!
I was given baclofen for spasms in my hands. The side effects, including blurred vision were prohibitive to taking for any length of time to properly rate any effectiveness of this drug.

I was taking baclofen for a few months, when I noticed it made me sweat like crazy. It seems that after the initial start of the medication, it just became ineffective. I felt relief for the muscle tightness and random spasms, but now I don't want to take it because it makes me sweat so much. I am hoping I can try Soma. There seems to be a lot of positive reviews.

Lioresal (baclofen):I have suffered with back pain and muscle spasms for almost ten years.  Sleeping through the night only happened in my dreams.  Travel was limited by the necessity to stop frequently, get out and walk/stretch.  A 200 mile trip could take 6 hours.  Hotel beds were excruciating.  After three weeks of routine dosing,  my dreams are now a reality.  Sleeping thru the night, driving for extended periods and staying away from home overnight have given me my life back.  One word of caution, with your doctor's guidance, start with a small dose and be patient as the dose is increased.  Beginning large may cause extreme sleepiness.  Yep, the voice of experience.  Fell asleep in mid sentence!

I have been taking baclofen for a couple of months now for severe muscle spasms. Not only does it help those muscle spasms, but I have borderline personality disorder, and this medication has given me a sense of well-being. I also have severe anxiety, I find when I take the baclofen, (80 mgs a day) I do not feel anxious, nor do I have anxiety attacks. I believe more research needs to be done on this drug about its effects on different types of mental illness.

If you're taking baclofen for general back spasms, BEWARE. There are so many other medicines that do a great job instead of baclofen. This is from "side effects"'Do not use baclofen at a time when muscle tone is needed to assure safe balance and movement for certain activities. In some situations, it may endanger your physical safety to be in a state of reduced muscle tone'.Well, muscle tone is needed to stand and do normal activities. BEWARE: do not take it when drinking alcohol.
Felt sick when I started taking it plus tired but got used to it. Has really helped my muscles.

I was put on baclofen for muscle spasms caused from spinal stenosis.  It works quite well for me.  If I miss a dose, I can feel the difference. My doctor increased my dose to the maximum when I had more episode of my leg spasming.

I take 10 mg at night for intense right leg spasms that were occurring every morning and sometimes multiple times per day. Very painful and debilitating. First week on Baclofen felt a bit drowsy at night, but that quickly subsided. It has almost entirely taken away the morning spasms, leg only feels a bit tight when it wants/needs to spasm. This medicine has changed my life! If I miss one dose, the spasms quickly return. I definitely recommend this to anyone with spasm pain.
I went cold turkey off 131 mgs of methadone and I am on baclofen for muscle spasms. I was on 3 a day but now down to one because of my liver, but it is a good medicine.
It worked well for relief of spasms, but the side effects off-set any real value.
Lioresal Intrathecal (baclofen):This medicine has diminished my muscle spasms which resulted post-polio, but has not eliminated them.

Have been put on baclofen for spasms in legs and back after back fusion for injury due to train crash. The benefit has been enormous. I can now sleep, walk and lead an almost normal life. I only take 5mg three times a day.

I have severe muscle spasms due to Multiple Sclerosis. I don't know where I would be without this medication. I will most likely have to go up a notch on my dosage very soon but it helps greatly so I don't care as long as it keeps helping me.
Lioresal (baclofen):I have been taking baclofen for a few months for severe spasms and it is very effective with no drowsiness.

I have tried many spasm medications since 2002 for major muscle spasms. I was in a car accident and now I'm left with very bad uncontrollable spasms. This is the only one that worked, but after 6 years of taking it, it doesn't work anymore but for short term usage of this medication it works very well.

I have been suffering from a dull and persistent pain on the right side of my abdomen near my rib cage for several months. I had blood tests and abdominal ultrasound with results indicating "normal" appearance.  The pain persisted and I could control it to some extent (not great) with Tylenol extra strength.  Then I asked my doctor to prescribe 10mg baclofen, which I have been taking 3 times daily for about two weeks.  I noticed my abdominal pain eased after 2 days of the medication.  I haven't been experiencing abdominal pain except on rare occasion since I have been taking baclofen.  I feel totally functional and thankful that I don't have to live in pain any longer.
I used it with Coricidin and experienced hallucinations. Do not take with Coricidin.

I am an outdoor type of person, but since taking 10 mg of baclofen 3 times a day as directed, I have to cover up at all times when outdoors. Causes the skin to burn even by less than 30 minutes of sunlight.
Works great on lower back pain. Took one pill at night and one in the morning and the spasm was gone. I'm sure glad my doctor wrote me the prescription for baclofen.
I'm on 60 mgs a day for muscle spasms and this is the first time in over a year that I can move without feeling like my muscles are going to snap like an old rubber band.
With 20 years of MS under my belt, it keeps me moving.

This medicine saved me during a sudden, incredibly intense muscle spasm in my neck/back. Side effects were mostly drowsiness but it gave me time to heal and let me sleep during the painful period. Great medication.

Baclofen has been the best relief for my back problems in many years. A doctor in our town has refused to write me a prescription for baclofen stating it is 'bad' for me. Instead he says I should take 2 tylenol 500 3 times a day EVERY day. Not sure what he is thinking, but I'm sure I don't need that much tylenol in my system on a permanent basis.  I only use the baclofen on an as needed basis.
its good medication due to its rapid onset of action , safety on GIT tract,relief of pain begins after few hours of absorption
